definition: tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: Jack Daniels's whiskey is mellowed using Sugar Maple charcoal.
sentences.chinese: 過濾和軟化這種威士忌的是楓木炭。

sentences.english: The commandos blackened their faces with charcoal.
sentences.chinese: 那名突擊隊員用木炭把他的臉塗黑。

sentences.english: I hope I can have a wonderful BBQ at home with these charcoals.
sentences.chinese: 我希望我能用這些木炭弄出一個完美的BBQ。

sentences.english: The commando blackened his face with charcoal.
sentences.chinese: 那名突擊隊員用木炭把他的臉塗黑。

sentences.english: Prohibition of felling natural forest in china made the resource of charcoal limited very much.
sentences.chinese: 自然森林的禁伐使木炭的來源受到極大限制。

sentences.english: Braque eked out his collages with charcoal.
In one or two years they will be reached by those who take charcoal.
sentences.chinese: 一到兩年他們就會被那些使用木炭的人接觸到。

sentences.english: Another device breaks up charcoal produced from burned corncobs .
sentences.chinese: 另一個裝置休息了木炭燃燒產生的玉米芯。

sentences.english: That's why he gave up painting in favour of pastels and charcoal drawings.
sentences.chinese: 正因爲如此，他爲了臘筆畫和木炭畫而放棄了油畫。

sentences.english: Already, in 2003, children in charcoal had scandalized people around the world.
sentences.chinese: 在2003年，在木炭業的兒童們使全世界的人憤慨。

sentences.english: The third zone is made up of charcoal from the second zone.
sentences.chinese: 第三區是由木炭從第二個區。

sentences.english: Above me, the stars are specks of silver paint on a charcoal canvas.
sentences.chinese: 在我頭頂上方，星星如散落在木炭畫布上的銀色斑點。

sentences.english: Increased length of effect for Charcoal Pine Bundle and Gold Pine Bundle.
sentences.chinese: 增加了木炭松包和金松包的效果長度。

sentences.english: I can't describe the color—charcoal, brown.
sentences.chinese: 我無法形容那顏色，像木炭，深褐色。

sentences.english: We learned charcoal drawing in the art class.
sentences.chinese: 我們在美術課上學習了木炭畫。

sentences.english: I plant the production of machine-made charcoal is made of pure wood processing.
sentences.chinese: 我廠生產的機制木炭是純木屑加工而成的。

definition: to manufacture charcoal/to burn charcoal (often a reference to suicide by carbon monoxide poisoning)
